nodes.documentation: @dev Mint manages a Dai/yDai pair. Note that Dai is underlying, not collateral, and therefore the functions are minting and redeeming, instead of borrowing and repaying.
nodes.name: Mint

nodes.documentation:
@dev Mint yDai by posting an equal amount of Dai.
 If the Lender has debt it is paid, otherwise the dai is converted into chai
nodes.name: mint

nodes.documentation:
@dev Burn yTokens and return an equal amount of underlying.
 If the Saver has savings they are used to deliver the dai to the user, otherwise dai is borrowed from MakerDao
nodes.name: redeem

devdoc.details: Mint manages a Dai/yDai pair. Note that Dai is underlying, not collateral, and therefore the functions are minting and redeeming, instead of borrowing and repaying.

mint(address,uint256).details: Mint yDai by posting an equal amount of Dai. If the Lender has debt it is paid, otherwise the dai is converted into chai

redeem(address,uint256).details: Burn yTokens and return an equal amount of underlying. If the Saver has savings they are used to deliver the dai to the user, otherwise dai is borrowed from MakerDao
